content:
• Friday, September 14, 2012
  • FCX

    Copper futures (JJC +2.2%) jump 3.3% to their highest settlement in five months as investors...

    Copper futures (JJC +2.2%) jump 3.3% to their highest settlement in five months as investors flocked to buy in the wake of the Fed's QE3 decision. TD Securities' Bart Melek is mindful that U.S. copper demand had slumped 18% in 2009 before the launch of QE2; by Q4 2011, demand had surged 9.4% Y/Y to 424K metric tons.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • UNG

    As stocks and oil look to extend gains to cap a big week, natural gas (UNG -2.2%) tumbles 3.1%...

    As stocks and oil look to extend gains to cap a big week, natural gas (UNG -2.2%) tumbles 3.1% as MDA Earthsat says below-average temperatures likely will be “widespread” across the Midwest over the next 6-to-10 days and the East Coast will be chillier over the next 11-to-15 days. "Cooler temps are going to keep the pressure on the bulls," one analyst says.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM | 6 Comments
  • GMO

    The Street appears to be applauding the recent executive appointments at General Moly (GMO...

    The Street appears to be applauding the recent executive appointments at General Moly (GMO +4.2%) announced today. The company says it's selected Michael Iannacchione as general manager of the company's Mt. Hope project, and Patrick C. Rogers as vice president of permitting & environmental compliance. It also promoted Zach Spencer to director of external communications.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • CEO

    U.S. opposition grows against the proposed takeover of Nexen (NXY -0.3%) by Cnooc (CEO +3.7%),...

    U.S. opposition grows against the proposed takeover of Nexen (NXY -0.3%) by Cnooc (CEO +3.7%), as a group of four Republican senators sends a letter to Tim Geithner expressing concern that a deal would hand over "valuable and critical areas of U.S. sovereignty" to a Chinese-controlled entity. ~10% of NXY's assets are in the U.S., so U.S. approval is needed for the deal to go through.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM | 3 Comments

  • Trina Solar (TSL -1.6%) isn't taking part in today's solar rally thanks to a downgrade to...

    Trina Solar (TSL -1.6%) isn't taking part in today's solar rally thanks to a downgrade to Underperform from Raymond James. Shares rallied on Wednesday in response to a restructuring plan that will feature job cuts and the splitting of the company's solar module and systems businesses.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • TGI

    Aircraft component maker Triumph Group (TGI +2.3%) moves higher after Credit Suisse called it...

    Aircraft component maker Triumph Group (TGI +2.3%) moves higher after Credit Suisse called it "one of the most compelling names in commercial aerospace," and boosted its forecast after meeting with management. The firm says it's increasingly confident with the company's margins, and thinks consensus estimates will be upped in FY13.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • OSK

    OshKosh (OSK +6.7%) gains after saying it's aiming to double per-share earnings by 2015, as the...

    OshKosh (OSK +6.7%) gains after saying it's aiming to double per-share earnings by 2015, as the specialty truck maker looks to turn around its results in the wake of lighter defense spending.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • MTP

    Dara Biosciences (DARA +20.7%) regains yesterday's upward move plus more after saying it's...

    Dara Biosciences (DARA +20.7%) regains yesterday's upward move plus more after saying it's signed an exclusive agreement with The Helsinn Group of Switzerland for the U.S. commercial rights to Gelclair. Gelclair is an FDA-cleared topical gel topical gel used to reduce pain from oral mucositis.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM
  • LAKE

    Lakeland Industries (LAKE -5%) slips after reporting a Q2 that beat on a per share basis, but...

    Lakeland Industries (LAKE -5%) slips after reporting a Q2 that beat on a per share basis, but came up short on revenue due declining sales and settlement charges. The company says it will pay $8.5M in a settlement reached in its Brazilian arbitration, with total costs estimated at $7.9M. The company also says it's begun evaluating strategic alternatives.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • SNE

    Sony (SNE +7.5%), which is more than taking part in today's big Asian rally, says it has "no...

    Sony (SNE +7.5%), which is more than taking part in today's big Asian rally, says it has "no current plans" to support Windows Phone 8 (NASDAQ:MSFT), though it doesn't rule out supporting an OS other than Android. The company's Xperia Android phones have seen modest success internationally, but its market share has fallen thanks to a high-end/low-end pincer movement from Samsung and Chinese OEMs. Big job cuts for Sony's mobile unit are on the way.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • AKS

    AK Steel (AKS -4.8%) is missing out on the QE-fueled rally in materials shares after warning of...

    AK Steel (AKS -4.8%) is missing out on the QE-fueled rally in materials shares after warning of a larger than expected Q3 loss as it contends with lower average per-ton selling prices. AKS cited lower spot market prices for carbon steel products because of declining global economic conditions. Other steel names are posting strong gains: X +2.9%, MT +6.9%, STLD +4.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • DS

    Newcastle Investment (NCT +4%) hits a 52-week high as the sale of the firm's interest in a CDO...

    Newcastle Investment (NCT +4%) hits a 52-week high as the sale of the firm's interest in a CDO will remove the impact of its negative book value from the NCT balance sheet and generate about a $200M gain in Q3. As part of the sale, the company purchased $101M face value in collateral held by the CDO for about 50% of par. The fancy footwork speaks well of management and of 5 more CDOs the company still manages. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM | 2 Comments
  • CUR

    Neuralstem (CUR -13.7%) continues to give back it's big gains from yesterday, declining again...

    Neuralstem (CUR -13.7%) continues to give back it's big gains from yesterday, declining again today after pricing a secondary offering for 7M shares at $1.00 per share, a 27% discount to its previous close. The company intends to use the funds for clinical trials, R&D as well as other general purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM | 2 Comments
  • PVG

    Pretium (PVG -2%) is one of the few natural resource stocks in the red, adding to yesterday's...

    Pretium (PVG -2%) is one of the few natural resource stocks in the red, adding to yesterday's 3.4% decline after a disappointing resource estimate update from its Brucejack gold project in British Columbia led to a CIBC rating downgrade on concern about the significant variance in inferred category resources relative to an April estimate.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM | 1 Comment
  • CAT

    Caterpillar (CAT +2.9%) shares climb as CFO Mike DeWalt sees an improved selling season...

    Caterpillar (CAT +2.9%) shares climb as CFO Mike DeWalt sees an improved selling season upcoming in China. CAT's long-term mining business is "favorable," DeWalt says, although miners are remaining cautious; construction is still "fairly depressed" with housing starts still poor despite some improvement.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM | 3 Comments
  • WERN

    A couple of Wall Street firms react to Werner's (WERN -7.4%) disappointing Q3 guidance: Wells...

    A couple of Wall Street firms react to Werner's (WERN -7.4%) disappointing Q3 guidance: Wells Fargo cut its rating to Market Perform, saying cost headwinds will be more problematic, while Citigroup cites rising operating expenses amid a weak freight environment as justification for downgrading the trucker to Neutral.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • BIOF

    The surge in BioFuel Energy (BIOF +42.1%) continues, sparked by David Einhorn's increased stake...

    The surge in BioFuel Energy (BIOF +42.1%) continues, sparked by David Einhorn's increased stake in the company, but Street Insider says a closer look at the 13D filing suggests the new shares were given to Einhorn and his Greenlight Capital fund for free pursuant to a "true-up" agreement.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM

  • Solar stocks aren't getting left out of today's Bernanke-fueled move into risk assets (TAN...

    Solar stocks aren't getting left out of today's Bernanke-fueled move into risk assets (TAN +2.4%) - First Solar (FSLR +8.3%) is leading the way. Yesterday, the Chinese government announced solar investments will reach CNY250B ($39.5B) during its 2011-2015 5-year plan. The announcement was well-received by local manufacturers, but U.S. and E.U. regulators might be worried about the details.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • JRCCQ

    Coal shares are on a roll - JRCC +11.4%, ANR +7.2%, ACI +6.9%, WLT +4.9%, BTU +3.8% - but Paul...

    Coal shares are on a roll - JRCC +11.4%, ANR +7.2%, ACI +6.9%, WLT +4.9%, BTU +3.8% - but Paul Ausick reminds of the sector's long-running ailments: ANR is saddled with debt and its met coal business amounts to only 20%-25% of its shipments; JRCC’s met coal business is weak, and thermal coal prices aren’t rising very fast; ACI’s assets in Appalachia have been a drag.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 9 Comments

  • Glu Mobile (GLUU +2.9%) trades higher after CEO Niccolo de Masi tells Reuters he expects the...

    Glu Mobile (GLUU +2.9%) trades higher after CEO Niccolo de Masi tells Reuters he expects the mobile game developer to get a lift from iPhone 5 sales. Masi notes Glu expects 2/3 of its 2012 revenue to come from iOS games (previous), and that Q4 '11 sales beat expectations because of strong iPhone 4S demand. He adds Glu plans to release 8-10 more mobile games through the end of the year, all of which will run on the iPhone 5.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • CEO

    Nexen (NXY -0.2%) shares lag the market due to cautious comments from Canadian finance minister...

    Nexen (NXY -0.2%) shares lag the market due to cautious comments from Canadian finance minister Jim Flaherty related to the company's proposed takeover by Cnooc (CEO +4%). Flaherty downplays reports that he had privately warned colleagues that blocking the bid would hurt investor confidence and damage relations with China.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM | 1 Comment
  • FB

    Recent Internet IPOs are staging a big rally. FB +4.6%. ZNGA +5%. GRPN +7.4%. LNKD +3.8%. YELP...

    Recent Internet IPOs are staging a big rally. FB +4.6%. ZNGA +5%. GRPN +7.4%. LNKD +3.8%. YELP +5.4%. A positive Raymond James report on Facebook's ad efforts could be helping, but it looks like short-covering is a major factor.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM | 1 Comment

  • Shares of Fossil (FOSL +8.4%) take flight in a topsy-turvy week that saw the company get swept...

    Shares of Fossil (FOSL +8.4%) take flight in a topsy-turvy week that saw the company get swept into a luxury stock selloff and lose its CFO. Some traders have been latching onto the notion that Fossil's forward P-E ratio of 14 makes shares attractive with worries on Europe and China already baked in.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM | 1 Comment

  • A low valuation is minimizing Western Digital's (WDC -3.2%) losses following yesterday's...

    A low valuation is minimizing Western Digital's (WDC -3.2%) losses following yesterday's warning. A dividend announcement and massive new buyback are also helping. Nonetheless, FBN is downgrading WDC to Sector Perform: the firm isn't happy with Intel's warning and Dell and H-P's weak PC sales, and also notes WDC's guidance for a Sep. quarter hard drive market of 140M units is below a 150M consensus. Seagate (STX -1%), which has seen a raft of downgrades, is up fractionally.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • HAL

    Halliburton (HAL +3.1%) is searching for a seven-inch tube containing radioactive material that...

    Halliburton (HAL +3.1%) is searching for a seven-inch tube containing radioactive material that went missing in West Texas earlier this week. The tube is used in the measuring and evaluating of conditions within oil and gas wells; HAL warns the public not to touch or handle it. Shares are rising along with other energy and materials stocks in the post-Fed glow.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 3 Comments

  • Shares of SkyWest (SKYW +10.7%) soar after the carrier announces a 6.5M stock repurchase plan....

    Shares of SkyWest (SKYW +10.7%) soar after the carrier announces a 6.5M stock repurchase plan. Sentiment also got a boost when Raymond James upgraded the company to Strong Buy from Outperform.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • IOC

    InterOil (IOC +10.7%) shares spike after CFO Collin Visaggio says at least two supermajors have...

    InterOil (IOC +10.7%) shares spike after CFO Collin Visaggio says at least two supermajors have made bids for an operating stake in IOC's Gulf LNG project in Papua New Guinea. Negotiations between competing parties have also generated interest on whether IOC could be subject to a takeover offer.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM | 1 Comment
  • AAPL

    Apple (AAPL +1.7%) and its suppliers are outperforming after the iPhone 5's initial stock...

    Apple (AAPL +1.7%) and its suppliers are outperforming after the iPhone 5's initial stock apparently sold out less than an hour after pre-orders began. CRUS +7.1%. SWKS +2.6%. OVTI +1.9%. TQNT +4.3%. BRCM +1.7%. Thus far at least, the situation bears a resemblance to the 4S launch, with criticism about an "incremental" upgrade and other issues failing to prevent huge sales from occurring. And the iPhone 5 is definitely a bigger upgrade than the 4S.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM | 3 Comments
  • JOY

    Joy Global (JOY +6.7%) CEO Mike Sutherland is confident China will continue to rely on cheap...

    Joy Global (JOY +6.7%) CEO Mike Sutherland is confident China will continue to rely on cheap coal imports since it is too expensive to mine coal in China. While many utilities have been forced to get rid of coal for their power, Sutherland plans to continue to expand in emerging markets, particularly Asia. Jim Cramer views the stock as a "darkest before the dawn" situation.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM

  • Lexmark (LXK +5.9%) rallies after Bernstein argues the hard-luck printer maker should...

    Lexmark (LXK +5.9%) rallies after Bernstein argues the hard-luck printer maker should significantly beat 2012 and 2013 EPS estimates thanks to its plans to abandon its money-losing inkjet business. A low valuation has helped Lexmark bounce strongly off its July lows.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM
  • SPLS

    Office supply chains Staples (SPLS +3.5%), Office Depot (ODP +3.8%), and Office Max (OMX +5.2%)...

    Office supply chains Staples (SPLS +3.5%), Office Depot (ODP +3.8%), and Office Max (OMX +5.2%) post strong gains following late news yesterday that Staples is drawing interest from P-E firms. While still far from being back in favor, sentiment on the sector has picked up a bit with costs getting trimmed and back-to-school sales reported to be brisk.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM | 1 Comment

  • Splunk (SPLK +4.3%) makes new highs after Needham start coverage with a Buy and $42 target. The...

    Splunk (SPLK +4.3%) makes new highs after Needham start coverage with a Buy and $42 target. The firm sees the ongoing explosion in the amount of machine data being churned out by IT gear driving demand for Splunk's software, which tries to make sense out of it, and also sees potential for the company to increase sales at existing customers. Splunk soared two weeks ago after delivering a strong FQ2 report.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • F

    Ford (NYSE:F) says it’s cutting consumption of rare earths used in its hybrid and...

    Ford (NYSE:F) says it’s cutting consumption of rare earths used in its hybrid and electric cars by 500K lbs./year and will save hundreds of dollars per car in the process. But shares of rare-earth leader Molycorp (MCP +5.6%) shoot higher anyway, adding to gains a day after China announced a 40% cut in the number of permits to mine rare earths. REE +5.7%, AVL +4.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM | 8 Comments
  • AMTG

    Apollo Residential Mortgage (NYSE:AMTG) declares $0.85/share quarterly dividend, 13.3% increase...

    Apollo Residential Mortgage (NYSE:AMTG) declares $0.85/share quarterly dividend, 13.3% increase from prior dividend of $0.75. Forward yield 15.88%. For shareholders of record Sep 28. Payable Oct 31. Ex-div date Sep 26. Shares +2.4% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM
  • BIOF

    Premarket gainers: BIOF +14%. ALOG +12%. MTL +7%. MT +6%. Losers: CUR -17%. AUMN -16%. WERN...

    Premarket gainers: BIOF +14%. ALOG +12%. MTL +7%. MT +6%.
    Losers: CUR -17%. AUMN -16%. WERN -10%. RP -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • JRCCQ

    Coal names continue to climb higher in premarket trading, adding to yesterday's big gains: JRCC...

    Coal names continue to climb higher in premarket trading, adding to yesterday's big gains: JRCC +5.1%, ACI +4.2%, ANR +4%, YZC +3%, WLT +2.9%, BTU +1.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:56 AM | 4 Comments
  • UNH

    UnitedHealth Group (NYSE:UNH) +3% premarket on news it will replace Kraft in the DJIA. KFT -0.6%...

    UnitedHealth Group (NYSE:UNH) +3% premarket on news it will replace Kraft in the DJIA. KFT -0.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM | 2 Comments
  • AUMN

    Golden Minerals (NYSEMKT:AUMN) -15.9% premarket after announcing an underwriting agreement to...

    Golden Minerals (NYSEMKT:AUMN) -15.9% premarket after announcing an underwriting agreement to sell nearly 5.5M units at $5.75 each. Net proceeds will be used to continue further development and expansion of its Velardena Operations in Mexico, and for working capital and other general corporate purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:40 AM | 2 Comments
  • USO

    Tacking on $2 since the Fed's QE announcement, WTI crude is back in triple digits and hopes from...

    Tacking on $2 since the Fed's QE announcement, WTI crude is back in triple digits and hopes from 10 weeks ago of gasoline below $3 gallon give way to worries of the price popping through $4. What Fed stimulus gives on one hand, it takes away with another (good luck getting them to admit it!). USO +1.6% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:29 AM | 4 Comments
  • RIO

    Rio Tinto (NYSE:RIO) is pushing ahead with expansion of its Canadian mineral sands operations,...

    Rio Tinto (NYSE:RIO) is pushing ahead with expansion of its Canadian mineral sands operations, holding to plans to invest C$800M over five years to extend the life of its Lac Tio ilmenite mine in Quebec and overhaul a titanium dioxide smelter in the Canadian province. RIO +4.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:29 AM | 1 Comment
  • LVS

    Shares of Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS) trade 1.1% higher premarket after catching a price target...

    Shares of Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS) trade 1.1% higher premarket after catching a price target increase from Deutsche Bank. Analyst Carlo Santarelli thinks its actually good for shareholders looking for capital return that the firm's ambitious Eurovegas project in Madrid may never get off the ground. With its PT upped by $10 to $52, Deutsche now sees upside of another 15% on LVS.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:15 AM | 1 Comment

  • The dollar continues a big move lower following the Fed's open-ended QE announcement and...

    The dollar continues a big move lower following the Fed's open-ended QE announcement and Bernanke's anything it takes as long as it takes press conference. The euro +1% to $1.3116, the aussie +0.5% to $1.06 - neither of those handles have been seen for months. The loonie +0.4% to $1.0367, a 2012 high.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:13 AM

  • Asian and European shares are higher on the Fed's plan to buy bonds forever. "The open-ended...

    Asian and European shares are higher on the Fed's plan to buy bonds forever. "The open-ended nature of the plan is just extraordinary," says Sydney based analyst James White. Japan +1.8%, Hong Kong +2.8%, China +0.6%, India +2.1%. Euro Stoxx 50 +1.7%, London +1.3%, Paris +1.8%, Frankfurt +1.4%, Madrid +2.2%, Milan +1.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 AM
